titleInfo.title: Letter No 21 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter outlines the nature of the dispute between the Shaikhs of Bahrain and Rama bin Jaubir [Raḥmah bin Jābir]. It reports that the Resident's efforts to mediate the dispute have failed, and that it is his opinion that both sides are intent on violent revenge. It also notes that the Resident does not think that the Governor of Bushire can be depended upon to secure Rama bin Jaubir's good behaviour. The letter therefore requests instructions from the Bombay Government as to what he should do with Rama bin Jaubir's batille (a small sea going vessel), which he holds on deposit; he no longer sees any prospect that holding the vessel will affect a settlement.
